I'll push another commit based on @bgchun and @shravanmn's comments. While I'm at it, I'd appreciate it if we talk more about the `Gather` lexicographical order issue comment @shravanmn left.
@taegeonum I did my pass. I think we need to come up with a better name. NetworkServiceClient seems to be confusing. Talk to youngbin and geonwoo.
@taegeonum Let me know when you are ready for another round of code review.

known MPI gather semantics: the elements are ordered by the rank of the
process from which they were received.

@shravanmn, are you talking about the elements are ordered by the task id
lexicographically?

On Thu, Jul 9, 2015 at 9:52 PM, Jason (Joo Seong) Jeong <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I'll push another commit based on @bgchun https://github.com/bgchun and
> @shravanmn https://github.com/shravanmn's comments. While I'm at it,
> I'd appreciate it if we talk more about the Gather lexicographical order
> issue comment @shravanmn https://github.com/shravanmn left.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/226#issuecomment-119952056
> .

## 

Byung-Gon Chun
@markusweimer. Ready to review. Still missing the assignment of specific partitions to certain evaluators. Will do in other JIRA.
I'll do a pass.
@nachocano I've done a surface level pass.
I'll do another pass.
@jwang98052 I've done another pass. Minor typos and some C# questions for my education :-)
@markusweimer, I have adressed your feedback
I'll do another pass.
@beysims Done with my pass, one minor comment. Once that is addressed, I'll test on HDI.

After rebase, the build is broken as the issue described in REEF-466. You have to merge REEF-466 first, then merge to REEF-453 and testing. 
Debug build in master is broken now until REEF-466 is in.
@jwang98052 Yes, I noticed. REEF-466 is in now and I'll test this.
tests pass, I will merge
I've updated PR with merge-able resolution.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #58](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/58/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

Yes, since task ids are the closest to the ranks, when we initially designed the API, we decided that when the user does not specify an ordering, we will assume the lexicographic ordering of task-ids as the default order.
I'll merge this.

Also on top it says I am trying to merge two commits...why?

I see .. nothing I can do then I guess :)

Dhruv

On Thu, Jul 9, 2015 at 9:32 PM, Markus Weimer notifications@github.com
wrote:

> @dkm2110 https://github.com/dkm2110 we seem to suffer from the sync
> issue again, see INFRA-9778
> https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-9778
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/289#issuecomment-120222387
> .
Okay, I understand now. I'll change the implementation so that `GatherReceive.receive()` returns objects sorted in the lexicographical ordering of task ids.
@bgchun I've addressed all of your comments. Please take a look at them. Thanks!

Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

@taegeonum It looks good. Can you address the following checkstyle violation quickly so that I can test and merge this?

[INFO] There are 9 errors reported by Checkstyle 6.6 with lang/java/reef-common/src/main/resources/checkstyle.xml ruleset.
[ERROR] src/main/java/org/apache/reef/io/network/impl/NetworkConnectionServiceImpl.java[94](sizes) LineLength: Line is longer than 120 characters (found 135).
[ERROR] src/main/java/org/apache/reef/io/network/impl/NetworkConnectionServiceImpl.java[102](sizes) LineLength: Line is longer than 120 characters (found 121).
[ERROR] src/main/java/org/apache/reef/io/network/impl/NetworkConnectionServiceImpl.java[104](sizes) LineLength: Line is longer than 120 characters (found 132).
[ERROR] src/main/java/org/apache/reef/io/network/impl/NetworkConnectionServiceImpl.java[141](sizes) LineLength: Line is longer than 120 characters (found 127).
[ERROR] src/main/java/org/apache/reef/io/network/impl/NetworkConnectionServiceLinkListener.java[45](sizes) LineLength: Line is longer than 120 characters (found 132).
[ERROR] src/main/java/org/apache/reef/io/network/impl/NetworkConnectionServiceParameters.java[27](sizes) LineLength: Line is longer than 120 characters (found 135).
[ERROR] src/main/java/org/apache/reef/io/network/NetworkConnectionService.java[36](sizes) LineLength: Line is longer than 120 characters (found 138).
[ERROR] src/main/java/org/apache/reef/io/network/NetworkConnectionService.java[41](sizes) LineLength: Line is longer than 120 characters (found 167).
[ERROR] src/main/java/org/apache/reef/io/network/NetworkConnectionService.java[42](sizes) LineLength: Line is longer than 120 characters (found 149).
@bgchun Uh oh... This is strange. I've merged with master and I don't have any errors in my local machine.

Can you fetch and merge again? Are you sure you have the latest checkstyle
update?

On Fri, Jul 10, 2015 at 11:42 PM, Tae-Geon Um notifications@github.com
wrote:

> @bgchun https://github.com/bgchun Uh oh... This is strange. I've merged

Byung-Gon Chun
You need to fetch from the apache git, not this mirror. The mirroring broke down again :-(
@markusweimer  Got it. Thanks!

Commit changes that address only the errors. Don't commit the checkstyle
file.
